definition: to housekeep/housekeeping
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
hardworking and thrifty in running one's household

sentences.english: These girls possess suberb housekeeping skills.
sentences.chinese: 女孩們有出色的持家能力。

sentences.english: But the four walls of housekeeping legislation, treatment with triple brachial not Qi.
sentences.chinese: 持家但有四立壁，治病不蘄三折肱。

sentences.english: In the same sense, a dollhouse is a theory of the household.
sentences.chinese: 同樣道理，玩具屋就是關於持家的理論。

sentences.english: The good doctor had some interesting theories concerning plant 2)husbandry.
sentences.chinese: 這個好醫生對於如何持家有一番有趣的理論。

sentences.english: Humanity enjoins us to teach them agriculture and the domestic arts.
sentences.chinese: 基於人道精神我們乃教導他們農業與持家之道。

sentences.english: Many men do not appreciate how much work it takes to keep house and cook three meals a day .
sentences.chinese: 許多男人不理解操持家務和一天做三頓飯要幹多少活。

sentences.english: I shouldn’t say she had the homemaking instinct .
sentences.chinese: 我應該說她沒有持家的天性。

sentences.english: Many women still place emphasis on the importance of homemaking .
sentences.chinese: 許多女士仍然強調持家的重要。

sentences.english: Who runs his house for him since his wife is ill?
sentences.chinese: 由於他妻子生病了，誰來替他操持家務呢？

sentences.english: She ran her apartment with thrift and bought her clothes at trade prices.
sentences.chinese: 她持家勤儉，買衣裳花的是批發價錢。

definition: hardworking and thrifty in running one's household
variant of 賢慧|贤慧[xian2 hui4]
hardworking and frugal
(of a wife) wise and kind/perfect in her traditional roles
to take care of one's family
(of a woman) virtuous
a good wife and loving mother
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
(said of sb else's wife) a good wife
educated and well-balanced (idiom)
hardworking/industrious/diligent
to be industrious and frugal (idiom)
(old) perfect wife/you, my beloved wife
frugal/economical
to assist one's husband and educate the children (idiom)/the traditional roles of a good wife
to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
